name: La Quinta Inn Gainesville

reviews.text: We have stayed at this LaQuinta a few times. The location is easy access to I-75. Shopping and restaurants are close by. This is an older property with parking by the door, a feature that we like. The room is fairly good sized with a desk, desk chair, side chair, and recliner. With all the furniture there is still a decent amount of floor space. This room, (king, standard), did not include a fridge and micro wave. The room was clean and smelled nice upon arrival. We are partial to LaQuinta since they allow our dog to stay with us in the room with out an extra fee.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel at a Reasonable Price

reviews.text: Stayed here to bring my daughter to UF. First, I didn't know that this was a motel style inn. I prefer inside hallways. But, that aside, the room was substandard. The bathroom had stray hairs on the floor, the shower was a trickle of water on your head, the complimentary shampoo bottle they provided was dirty, the toilet had some brown stuff (don't want to think too much about that ) on the front of the bowl, the beds were uncomfortable. Also, they have satellite tv, and only have a few channels--none of the major ones. I couldn't wait to check out. Felt like I needed a shower after leaving there. We stayed here because we had difficulty finding a hotel due to late booking. In the future--I would rather stay a few exits away than stay at this La Quinta again! We have previously stayed at the Cabot Lodge which is nice.
reviews.title: Don't stay here!

reviews.text: Well, stayed here two nights while driving back from NOLA. Had points for one night and paid for the other. First was told hotel was booked, then the day before was told that we wouldn't get kicked out for the second night. We got in late and just ignored the sticky bathroom floor and overwhelming smell of dog. The next morning I find my husband sniffing the comforter wondering if our toddler had an accident - he didn't. The comforter reeked of urine. Yes, this is a pet-friendly hotel, but shouldn't those rooms be in a section or something? Have they ever had every room booked each with a pet?
reviews.title: Okay and Not So Okay

reviews.text: So we call the desk and tell them about the smell in the room and the urine-odor. They didn't offer an apology but said they'd take care of it, which they did.
reviews.title: BUGS!

reviews.text: Never did make it to breakfast as they stop serving at 9am/10am on weekends.
reviews.title: This place smells ok....

reviews.text: My stay was entirely booked through Priceline to visit family in Ocala. Arrival 04JUL10, Departure 07JUL10. During my stay I booked another room for my brother and his daughter who were visiting me. I paid for their room directly through La Quinta. The La Quinta rate vs Priceline was not much of a savings. If you have a La Quinta rewards # your best bet is to book entirely through La Quinta. I've learned Priceline is not always the bargain they claim to be.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay

reviews.text: The hotel is close to everything and was remarkable that you could not hear the noise from hwy 75. The beds were EXTREMELY comfortable and the room was spotless and the AC was frigid, just the way I like it. The office staff was friendly and helpful. Would I stay here again? Absolutely!
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable beds

reviews.text: The rooms were clean and the beds are comfortable. Compared to the La Quinta I stayed in the previous night, this is not up to La Quinta standards. It is an older, and I'm sure a remodeled property. The water pressure for the shower was not much more than a trickle, although lots of water from the tub faucet. If this is done to save water, it is not being accomplished as we had to take longer showers due to the low water pressure. Also, the water would change from warm to cold when other water was used close by. The wi-fi was also weak. when I asked at the front desk, I was told that was normal. I have not had any problem with wifi at other La Quintas. The breakfast was the most frustrating. It is served only until 9:00am, at a motel in Florida with people on vacation. And I think just about everyone in the motel descended upon the breakfast room at 8:45am. The waffle machine was slow - the waffles stuck to the griddle and the only thing suggested by the front desk was a wet rag. They said they were told by the manufacturer to not spray oil when the unit was hot, and with 5 and 10 people standing in line, it stayed hot. And the waffle mix dispenser constantly clogged up, but with no staff there to watch, that made getting a waffle a long procedure. At least they did not close down the breakfast room at 9AM when so many people were still waiting to eat. On Saturday morning, there was a man who tried to keep things better supplied and the line moving a little faster. We were there three mornings and there was no one to help the other two.
reviews.title: Better than we expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I happened to luck into a very good room rate, and was not rushed in the morning, so we were not too bothered by the lack of interest from the staff, especially compared to my first night stay at a La Quinta in another city. But if I had paid their normal rates, I would have felt more negative. And by the way, I got that same good rate at the earlier La Quinta. I would recommend this property to someone who understands the possibility of the lack of service. Maid service was very competent, so room was kept clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Good value, excellent beds, off I-75

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife, 2 young children and I stayed at the La Quinta during the Orange and Blue spring game. The room was nice and big..queen bed with a pull out couch (I think it was room 206). I noticed most of the rooms faced the parking lot, but ours did not and was very quiet. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean. We have stayed in much more expensive hotels that were smaller and dated. The breakfast was not so good. The kids liked the pool..which was heated so we Miamians could tolerate the cold. This is by no means the Ritz, so my rating is on a curve due to the price.
reviews.title: Nothing special

reviews.text: I booked this hotel through Priceline for a very low price. Immediately after booking, I went to Tripadvisor to see the reviews on this hotel. Based on the reviews, I was nervous.
reviews.title: Better than we expected (based on prior reviews)...

reviews.text: However, this hotel ended up being pretty decent – much better than some of the older reviews indicated. The rooms were clean – nothing special – typical motel style. The staff was friendly and helpful (we requested cribs for our young children). The free breakfast was a nice little bonus.
reviews.title: Good for what you pay for!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you’re looking for the Ritz Carlton, you’re not going to find it here. However, if you need a decent place to stay while you’re travelling down I-75 or visiting Gainesville for a couple days, this hotel is a great value.
reviews.title: great hotel, great value

reviews.text: This place is great if you are just passing through! It is of course not the Ritz, but our room was clean and I love La Quinta's pet policy.
reviews.title: No internet, and it was NOT my fault, as the staff would have it.

reviews.text: We stayed at La Quinta for 3 nights the first week in Oct and it was great. Check in was quick and simple and the front desk lady even offered to put us all close by. There were a few of us in town for a wedding. Breakfast was delicious and early which we really liked. Our room was prefect. A King bed on the first floor. I think it was 118. Very clean and spacious. Housekeeping was great cleaning out room and always leaving plenty of towels and soap. My only concern would be that the towels were really old. One of our hand towels was shredded and had a big hole in it. They should probably update those, but besides that everything was great. Also the pool was perfect for an afternoon dip.
reviews.title: Setting the Standard for Customer Service!

reviews.text: Stayed at the LQ for daughter's college graduation. Booked 2 rooms ourselves through LQ internet site, AAA rate was a very reasonable $53 plus tax. Requested 1st floor since we had an 80 y/o grandma with us. Upon check in I reminded the clerk of our 1st floor request and also asked if 1 room could have a walk in shower. No problem even on this busy graduation weekend. The rooms didn't connect, but, were side by side. Other relatives also booked and when they arrived asked if they could be placed near us. They were given the room directly above ours with easy access to the stairs connecting our rooms.
reviews.title: Average hotel, good location, nice staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All 3 rooms were relatively clean, spacious, and had free Wi-Fi. One room did smell of a pet disinfectant, but, it wasn't bothersome once the a/c was turned on. The beds were comfy.
reviews.title: "Scary" should not be a term used to describe lodging. This was scary lodging.

reviews.text: A basic free expanded continental breakfast was offered from 7-10am, but, we chose to sleep in instead of eat. The pool was clean and nice.
reviews.title: La Quinta Gainesville Fl
Don't Stay at this hotel. Stay anywhere else.
reviews.text: We didn't use housekeeping, but, talked to our maid who was very pleasant. She exchanged our towels, emptied our trash, and replenished soap/shampoo for us.

Location was great convenient to 75 and right off the main drag Newberry Rd/University Dr, but, really quite and convenient to a few restaurants to walk to. The Mall is directly across main drag. A hospital is extremely close and park is also within walking distance.
reviews.title: was very convenient to hospital.

description: NEW! Flat-panel TVs with 30 channels of HD programming. Easy-access Plug-and-Play feature makes it simple to connect electronics.Located just minutes from the O'Connell Center and the Phillips Center for Performing Arts at the University of Florida, the La Quinta Inn Gainesville is convenient to all area attractions. From here, visit the Butterfly Rainforest at the Museum of Natural History, the Harn Museum of Art, and the Kanapaha Botanical Gardens. Discover Payne's Prairie State Preserve. Spend the day on the water at Ginnie Springs. Have lots of fun at the Hippodrome State Theatre and the Gainesville Community Play House. Golf nearby Ironwood and Meadowbrook courses. We are surrounded by shopping at Oaks Mall and plenty of restaurants for every taste. You will love the spacious and colorful rooms at the La Quinta Inn Gainesville, equipped with free high-speed Internet access, a coffee maker, hair dryer, and more. Our heated swimming pool sits in a private courtyard surrounded by a sprawling sundeck. We provide our guests with privileges to a local fitness center. The hotel also offers theater-style meeting facilities for up to 35 guests. Enjoy a Free Bright Side BreakfastTM prepared mornings in the lobby by our friendly staff. Easy access from I-75 (exit 387) behind Red Lobster. Our location is also convenient for visitors to North Florida Regional and Shands Hospitals.We offer non-smoking in all of our king rooms!
